title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Groupon is an experiences marketplace that brings people more ways to get the most out of their city or wherever they may be. By enabling real-time mobile commerce across local businesses, live events and travel destinations, Groupon helps people find and discover experiences––big and small, new and familiar––that make for a full, fun and rewarding life. Groupon helps local businesses grow and strengthen customer relationships––resulting in strong, vibrant communities. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success.

Groupon is building an Analytics Center of Excellence and seeking an analyst who will help us manage and scale our analytical solutions. We are looking for someone who loves to observe data, is curious to learn, and is keen to identify trends that may enhance our value to customers and merchants. The team isn't simply proficient in SQL and statistics; they... also have a genuine love for using data to solve problems, a drive to pursue innovative new concepts, and a willingness to go the extra mile for execution.

We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and the potential to make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like an exciting place to work?

We are searching for someone who is passionate about enabling data-informed decision-making, enjoys finding root causes, fosters a growth mindset, and is continuously aiming to improve the quality of insights.

You’ll spend time on the following:

Acquiring business acumen
• Partner with decision-makers to comprehend the issues that our customers and merchants are facing
• What features/initiatives are planned, and what problems/benefits are they intended to address?
• Discover the Groupon customer/merchant journey and explore the specifics of each touchpoint
• What Key Performance Indicators are used to track the performance of businesses?
• What effect does a process or product have on our north star metrics and goals?
• What KPIs are important to the leaders of different lines of business?
• How does your work support Groupon's goals?

Insights development and socialising
• Measuring and tracking customer/merchant engagement, as well as the effects of a particular initiative or feature
• Scope, create, manage, improve, and scale an insights infrastructure to support data-informed choices
• Use SQL and Python/R to manipulate data
• Utilize visuals to transform data into actionable insights
• Develop and routinely enhance insightful, UX-friendly dashboards
• Surface knowledge and understanding to aid stakeholders in comprehending changes in KPIs and leading indicators
• Discover relationships in data
• Build and promote "what if" analysis to increase our ability to create recommendations
• Identify opportunities, quantify them, and highlight the potential of your proposals

We’re excited about you if you have:
• Solid understanding of regression, probability, correlation, and its application in analytics
• 5+ years of experience as an analyst
• 5+ years of experience using SQL
• 2+ years of experience using Python (Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib) / R (Dplyr, Ggplot2, Tidyr)
• 3+ years of experience with data visualization applications. Tableau preferred.
• Understanding of A/B testing
• A track record of using learnings to solve business problems
• Bachelor's degree in any discipline

title: Data Analyst (remote)
description:
Meet our Team
We represent Hitachi Vantara to enterprise clients across industries, establishing business relationships to understand customer challenges so that we can deliver profitable business for Hitachi products, services and solutions. We collaborate as a team and cross-functionally to ensure the success of our customers; success that is celebrated and shared. Our solutions bring value to every line of business and we need people like you to build those deep relationships and to passionately articulate our value proposition.

What you’ll be doing
Providing programming and best practice consultation directly to our clients and partners for the integration of our Enterprise Data Automation products and services with large, complex datasets.
Driving the partnership with other teams to understand client requirements, communicate product improvements, and assist with all client development needs.
Adopting and embracing our cultural and innovative best practices and solutions in... order to quickly and accurately identify and address highly technical problems.
Be solution focused, able to quickly and accurately perform detailed and meaningful diagnostic work and troubleshooting, developing additional tools where you see a need internally or for our clients.
Working closely with technical and data operations teams at client companies to understand their requirements.
Actively identifying potential areas of improvement or gaps in internal tools & monitoring systems and propose solutions.
Proactively identifying ideas to help drive stronger product performance and implement those ideas from start to finish.
Providing technical development guidance, leadership and structure to Enterprise Data clients.
Building strong stakeholder relationships with clients, engineering and product development teams to resolve issues or build out enhancements.
Administering training to clients for coding to our API during the pre-sale, implementation and adoption phases of an engagement.
Supporting the developer community around our data delivery mechanisms.
Providing timely and informative feedback to the Enterprise Data Automation Product teams.
Taking ownership of complex questions and issues reported by clients as a second tier of technical support via phone calls, ticket systems, email, and in person.

What you bring to the team
Proficiency at data development and analysis using SQL and Python.
Experience with structured data tools (e.g., SQL), & unstructured data tools and platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, NoSQL).
Experience with relational and non-relational databases such as Postgres, MySQL, MongoDB, or DynamoDB.
Familiarity with visualisation tools (e.g. Grafana, Kibana, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik).
Proficiency in at least one programming language, e.g., Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, C++, C.
Strong client facing experience, ability to articulate complex technical concepts to all skill levels.
Strong organisational skills, attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple technical streams / lead client engagements whilst collaborating across different teams.
Degree in Computer Science, Data Science or related field.
Additional language is an asset (Italian, French, Spanish or German).

Our Company
Hitachi Vantara is part of the Global Hitachi family. We balance innovation with an open, friendly culture and the backing of a long-established parent company, known for its ethical reputation. We guide customers from what’s now to what’s next by unlocking the value of their data and applications to solve their digital challenges, achieving outcomes that benefit both business and society.
Our people are our biggest asset, they drive our innovation advantage and we strive to offer a flexible and collaborative workplace where they can thrive. Diversity of thought is welcomed and our employee base is represented by several active Employee Resource Group communities. We offer industry leading benefits packages (flexible working, generous pension and private healthcare) and promote a creative and inclusive culture. If driving real change gives you a sense of pride and you are passionate about powering social good, we’d love to hear from you.

Our Values
We strive to create an inclusive environment for all and are open to considering home working, compressed/flexible hours and flexible arrangements. Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.
We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. With Japanese roots going back over 100 years, our culture is founded on the values of our parent company expressed as the Hitachi Spirit:
Wa – Harmony, Trust, Respect
Makoto – Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity
Kaitakusha-Seishin – Pioneering Spirit, Challenge
